==p1211.dat==

A typical p1211.dat file has the following format:

{{{
element
mesh
nels nn nr nip 
plasitersMax plasitersMin LoadIncrementMax cjits plastol
cjtol fftol ltol np_types numSteps
}}}

||*Variable Name*||*Type*||*Meaning*||
||{{{element}}} || Character || The element type. Permitted values are {{{hexahedron}}} and {{{tetrahedron}}}.||
||{{{mesh}}} || Integer || Element node ordering scheme. Permitted values are {{{1}}} (Smith and Griffiths scheme) or {{{2}}} (Abaqus scheme).||
||{{{nels}}} || Integer || Number of elements in the mesh.||
||{{{nn}}} || Integer || Number of nodes in the mesh.||
||{{{nr}}} || Integer || Number of restrained nodes in the mesh.||
||{{{nip}}} || Integer || Number of integration points.||
||{{{plasitersMax}}} || Integer || Number of plastic iterations at which the adaptive load stepping algorithm reduces step size.||
||{{{plasitersMin}}} || Integer || Number of plastic iterations at which the adaptive load stepping algorithm increases step size.||
||{{{LoadIncrementMax}}} || Integer || Upper limit for number of load increments.||
||{{{cjits}}} || Integer || Conjugate gradient iteration ceiling.||
||{{{plastol}}} || Real || Plastic iteration tolerance.||
||{{{cjtol}}} || Real || Conjugate gradient iteration tolerance.||
||{{{fftol}}} || Real || Tolerance on yield function.||
||{{{ltol}}} || Real || Tolerance on the sum of the body loads.||
||{{{np_types}}} || Integer || Number of different property types.||
||{{{numSteps}}} || Integer || Number of load steps.||
